column4: i`m using compaq v3200. How to enable wireless adapter on my kubuntu?
do lspci which listing is your wireless card please output that line
01:00.0 Network controller: Broadcom Corporation Dell Wireless 1390 WLAN Mini-PCI Card (rev 01)
have the same in my compaq

go here and download ndiswrapper http://ndiswrapper.sourceforge.net/joomla/ you have to extract it then do apt-get install build-essentials gcc gcc-3.4 g++ then cd in and do ./configure make sudo su make install
your card is #82 on this list http://ndiswrapper.sourceforge.net/joomla/index.php?/component/option,com_openwiki/Itemid,33/id,list_b/
http://wine.budgetdedicated.com/archive/ubuntu/feisty/wine_0.9.38~winehq0~ubuntu~7.04-1_i386.deb install wine so you can run the windows driver install then grab the .inf and .sys
man, you are SUPER FAST. I just about to open the url but u already found the driver.
I've told 567 users the same instructions this week

after you have the .inf and .sys do ndiswrapper -i bcmwl5.inf ndiswrapper -m modprobe ndiswrapper mousepad /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist add blacklist bcm43xx to bottom of list then save and restart computer
menu>>system>>network setup your wireless
your comp take too long downloading and compiling :P
yes
its still downloading
its so tiny though, are you on dial up?
I`m on 1Mbps adsl connection.
you also might need to apt-get install linux-headers-$(uname -r)
sudo aptitude install bcm43xx-fwcutter
Could not open lock file /var/lib/dpkg/lock - open (13 Permission denied
never tried that fwcutter thing
think the fwcutter method yields slower connection speeds rather than using ndiswrapper
just tell me when you give up and want to learn how to compile something
the internet connection here in kubuntu, is extremely slow, unlike what it used to be on my winxp a few hours ago. :D
